line_1: Moisten'd the eye of every opening bud,
line_2: And let them see their image in the flood;

line_1: Not only in the teeming bud,
A Flow'r, when offer'd in the Bud,
line_2: When we devote our Youth to GOD,

line_1: Unhappy Hour! when first, in youthful Bud,
line_2: I left the fair Sabrina's Silver flood:

line_1: Fills the fine lungs of all that breathe or bud,
line_2: Warms the new heart, and dyes the gushing blood;

line_1: And dash the Cynips from her damask bud;
line_2: Arm with sharp thorns the Sweet-brier's tender wood,

line_1: The tender nymph, herself a bud,
And call the roseate blossoms from the bud;
When the warm Spring puts forth the op'ning Bud,
line_2: Th'awaken'd Insects find their ready Food;

line_1: Giving new life to each expanding bud;
line_2: (Thus doubly seen) lighting a distant wood,

line_1: Should at a Word pronounc'd revive and bud:
line_2: For that a Branch cut off, a wither'd Rod

line_1: Aye cast upon the tide its falling bud,
line_2: Thereto along th' unlovely margin stood

line_1: Aye cast upon the tide its falling bud,
line_2: And with its bitter juice empoison'd all the flood.
